title.native: ガラスの艦隊～La legende du vent de l'univers～
title.romaji: Glass no Kantai: La legende du vent de l'univers
title.english: Glass Fleet: The Legend of the Wind of the Universe

description:
A revolution stirs in the dark reaches of space. Michel Volban leads The People’s Army against the oppression of self-proclaimed Holy Emperor, Vetti Sforza. Just as it appears the rebellion will be crushed, a hero arrives to join the fight. Pirate Cleo Corbeille—the last of the fallen Royal Family—steers his sleek battleship into battle and brings new hope that freedom can be obtained.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description: A voice actress and producer specializing in televised anime. Harp was hired by FUNimation Entertainment in 2003 to voice the character of Tweedledee in Kiddy Grade. Since then, her work has included Sei in Burst Angel, Sanae in Akira Kurosawa's Samurai 7, Hibari Ginza in Speed Grapher and additional roles in Yu Yu Hakusho, Spiral, Fullmetal Alchemist, Case Closed, Desert Punk, Baki the Grappler, The Galaxy Railways, Negima, and BECK.    Her portrayal as Hibari Ginza in the 2006-2007 release of Speed Grapher won her an award in the ADR Awards as voted by members of the websites Dub Review and Anime on DVD.    Harp is also the inspiration for Aubrey Chorde, one of the main characters in the webcomic Something Positive by her friend R.K. Milholland. He claims he decided to make the comic after she told him to do "something positive" with his life. She currently lives and works in the Dallas/Ft. Worth area of Texas. Her hobbies include knitting, crafts and collecting Hello Kitty Memorabilia. (Wikipedia)

Christopher Robin Sabat is an American voice actor, producer, ADR director, and line producer at Funimation. He provided voices for a number of English versions of Japanese anime series such as a number of Dragon Ball characters, including Vegeta, Piccolo, Yamcha, and some others. In Funimation's re-dubbing of One Piece, he voices Roronoa Zoro. Other major roles include Kazuma Kuwabara in Yu Yu Hakusho, Alex Louis Armstrong in Fullmetal Alchemist, Tatsumi Saiga in Speed Grapher, Kurogane in Tsubasa Reservoir Chronicle, Daisuke Jigen in Lupin the Third and All Might in My Hero Academia. In video games, he voiced Garland in Dissidia: Final Fantasy, Rundas in Metroid Prime 3: Corruption, Alex D in Deus Ex: Invisible War, and both Captain Smiley and Star in Comic Jumper. He is the founder and director of OkraTron 5000, an audio production company that provides support for some of Funimation's and other dubbing titles.

__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

__Height:__ 159 cm (5'3") 
__Hobbies:__ Table tennis, snowboarding 
__Special skill:__ Breakdancing

__[Website](http://www.anza.jp)__

She is the lead singer of Head Phones President (HPP) and Vitamin-Q.

Hiroko & Miyake on vocals.  mihimaru GT is a two-person group signed with the major record label Universal Music Japan. Made up of composer, lyricist, and vocalist Miyake and vocalist/lyricist Hiroko, the duet have tried their hand at fusing an urban sound with more traditional J-pop elements.  (Source: jame-world)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kadutaka_nue)

Kazutaka Miyatake is a visual artist and anime designer known for the mechanical design of the Macross TV series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue, of which he is a founding member. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny.

Kazutaka Miyatake has designed the spaceships of several famous anime series. His attention to detail and mechanical realism have made his designs still admired upon and used in anime series and related products after several years of their initial appearance.

Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.
Best known for his work on [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

__Doujin Circles:__ UB, Vachicalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okamarble)

A guy who chooses to only play female characters in games. Since he is called Okama (cross-dresser) after all.
Minoru Oohara is a Japanese director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/murahama)

After graduating from school he took social sciences at Otemon Gakuin University, where he belonged to the local SF club. During his time at university he participated in Daicon Film activities and after dropping out of university in 1987 he joined the former Daicon Film, now Gainax, where he participated as Production Manager in works such as Honneamise, Nadia and Top wo Nerae.

In 1992 he left together with Maeda Mahiro, Higuchi Shinji and Yamaguchi Hiroshi to establish a new studio, Gonzo, where he assumed the position of President and Representative Director. Currently he serves as Chairman of the Board and Representative Director at GDH.

Murahama left Gonzo on March 31, 2009 and launched a new company called Lambda Film on April 1, 2009, the same day that Gozo's parent company, GDH, absorbed Gonzo and adopted the Gonzo brand name for itself.

Murahama will serve as the representative director for Lambda Film's board of directors.

name.native: プラスティック トゥリー

node.description: Ryutaro Arimura (vocals) Akira Nakayama (guitar) Tadashi Hasegawa (bass) KenKen Satou (drums)  Plastic Tree (プラスティック トゥリ) is a Japanese rock band which formed in December 1993 in Chiba Prefecture, Japan.They released their first mini-album in December 1995, and in 1997, they debuted by releasing their first single on a major label.
